result.execSummary:
The defendant Andromeda Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 5/5/2022.
Agent to request probation review hearing with the Court if it is needed.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory supervision fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA  surcharge during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory court costs and fees.

No contact with victims I.R., B.R., R.R. or R.R.  except as authorized by DMCPS and  CHIPS.
No corporal punishment of any kind.
No contact with firearms.

Any programming with CHIPS can be applied to probation. Proof to be submitted to the agent.
Mental health evaluation.  Comply with recommended treatment.
parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Cooperate with CHIPS and DMCPS.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andromeda Robertson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andromeda Robertson in court with attorney Gregory W Isaac.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Arraignment held.  Original amended information has been e-filed; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading and pleads not guilty subject to the Court accepting change of plea today. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1, 2, & 3.  

Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.
Letter from Wellpoint Care Network, filed.
Character Letter from Shawanaki W, filed.
Character Letter from Dealaneo H, filed.
Letter from Divine Wellness and Counseling, filed.
Character Letter from Cherie R, filed.
Character Letter from Brian M, filed.

Attorney Gregory W Isaac in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Defense counsel requests a resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Stip and Order RE Forensic Interviews, signed and filed.

Defendant Andromeda Robertson in court with attorney Gregory W Isaac. Andromeda Robertson appeared by video means with Attorney.
Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom video.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant waives right to appear in person. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Matter set for status conference before Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond, filed.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver, filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 008008,
Payable Number: 981683,
Receipt Number: 22RP003793,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Andromeda Robertson in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Andromeda Robertson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andromeda Robertson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with IR (12/23/2008), BR (07/15/2010), RR (04/02/2013), and RR (05/26/2014)
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
